contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=October 2009}} [[Image:Zdenek veselovsky.jpg|thumb|250px|Zdeněk Veselovský in 2006.]] [[Prof.]] '''Zdeněk Veselovský''' (August 26, 1928 – November 24, 2006) was one of the most important [[Czech republic|Czech]] [[zoologist]]s of the 20th century, founder of Czech [[ethology]], very successful director of the [[Prague Zoo]] (1959-1988) and the president of the International Union of Directors of Zoological Gardens (1971-1975) (renamed in 2000 to [[World Association of Zoos and Aquariums]]). Under his leadership, the Prague zoo reached some successes{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} in the area of breeding and scientific research. {{Authority control|VIAF=64123143}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Veselovsky, Zdenek | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Czech zoologist | DATE OF BIRTH = August 26, 1928 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = November 24, 2006 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Veselovsky, Zdenek}} [[Category:1928 births]] [[Category:2006 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction]] [[Category:Czech zoologists]] [[Category:Ethologists]] [[Category:Members of the European Academy of Sciences and Arts]] {{CzechRepublic-scientist-stub}} {{Zoologist-stub}}
